20260116-songs-for-a-new-world-by-waco-c.title: Songs for a New World by Waco Civic Theatre
20260116-songs-for-a-new-world-by-waco-c.rss_description_html: Jason Robert Brown’s powerful and moving song cycle, Songs for a New World — a stunning collection of stories about life, love, and the moments that define us. From the deck of a Spanish sailing ship to the top of a New York penthouse, each song captures a pivotal “new world” moment — when decisions are made, dreams are tested, and hearts are laid bare. With unforgettable music and soul-stirring lyrics, this production is an incredible showcase for passionate, dynamic vocalists and storytellers.

20260206-sweat-by-playhouse-2000.title: Sweat by Playhouse 2000
20260206-sweat-by-playhouse-2000.venue_name: Cailloux City Center for the Performing Arts & VK Garage Theatre
20260206-sweat-by-playhouse-2000.rss_description_html:
Sweat is a searing drama about friendship, loyalty, and the economic fault lines that tear communities apart. Set in a working-class town facing job loss and industrial decline, it tells the story of lifelong friends whose relationships fracture under the weight of economic insecurity.

The play gives voice to the struggles of a small-town economy, the insecurity of shifting opportunity, and the dignity of hard work with honesty and empathy. It invites us to see our neighbors in the characters, sparking conversation about resilience, fairness, and what it means to hold a community together in hard times.

Winner of 2017’s Pulitzer Prize and multiple other awards,

Sweat is rated R for language and mild violence.

CAST

Evan/Brucie - Marcus Fifer
Jason - Brandon Newton
Chris - Treston Woods
Stan - Justin Elliott
Oscar - Victor Salinas
Tracey - Lisa Calvet-Smith
Cynthia - Cheri Brown
Jessie - Donna Provencher

20260710-rock-of-ages-by-tex-arts.title: Rock of Ages by Tex-Arts
20260710-rock-of-ages-by-tex-arts.rss_description_html: Rock of Ages is a jukebox musical set in 1987 on the Sunset Strip, where an aspiring rocker,Drew, and a small-town girl, Sherrie, fall in love while chasing their dreams. Their romance, along with the fate of a legendary rock club called the Bourbon Room, is threatened when German developers plan to tear it down. The story follows the group of misfits and rockers who must band together to save the club through a series of 1980s rock anthems.

20260410-the-count-will-rise-again-or-dr.title: The Count Will Rise Again, or Dracula in Dixie by Navasota Theatre Alliance
20260410-the-count-will-rise-again-or-dr.rss_description_html:
The Dracula legend goes South in this outrageous spoof featuring the world's first Yankee vampire, Count Dracula of Pennsylvania. The action takes place on the plantation of Doc Stewart, a proper Southern gentleman physician who runs a kind of halfway house of "recovering politicians and other emotionally disturbed persons." The trouble starts when Count Dracula moves into nearby Plantation Catfax and encounters plumbing problems. Invited to stay as a houseguest with Doc Stewart until they're cleared up, the Count begins some dirty work of his own. Soon the Doc's niece, Miss Lucy, and her friend, Miss Mina, begin experiencing anemia, general poor health, and disturbing dreams featuring an ominous figure who "looks like Mick Jagger!" All the ingredients for a fast and furious farce of wild laughter and screaming action!

Written by Dennis Snee. Directed by John W Baldwin.

 

​

20260806-the-seagull-by-classic-theatre-.title: The Seagull by Classic Theatre of San Antonio
20260806-the-seagull-by-classic-theatre-.rss_description_html: Chekhov’s masterful exploration of love, art, and human longing comes to life in The Seagull. This poignant drama follows a group of artists, lovers, and dreamers as they wrestle with ambition, heartache, and the passage of time. A timeless classic filled with rich characters and thought-provoking themes, The Seagull is a powerful look at the complexity of human emotions and artistic pursuit.

20260626-evita-by-san-pedro-playhouse.title: Evita by San Pedro Playhouse
20260626-evita-by-san-pedro-playhouse.venue_name: Russell Hill Rogers Stage, San Pedro Playhouse, San Antonio
20260626-evita-by-san-pedro-playhouse.venue_address: 800 West Ashby Place San Antonio, TX, 78212
20260626-evita-by-san-pedro-playhouse.rss_description_html: Witness the rise of a legend in Evita. This riveting musical tells the story of Eva Perón’s transformation from a poor, ambitious teenager to the powerful First Lady of Argentina. Set to Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice’s unforgettable score—including “Don’t Cry for Me Argentina” and “Buenos Aires”—Evita is a sweeping tale of fame, power, and the complex woman behind the myth. Winner of multiple Tony Awards, it’s a theatrical experience that resonates with passion and political drama.

20251219-the-mutt-cracker-sweet-by-circu.title: The Mutt-Cracker (SWEET!) by Circus Chickendog
20251219-the-mutt-cracker-sweet-by-circu.rss_description_html:
The Mutt-Cracker (SWEET!) provides the most extraordinary original, holiday entertainment in Austin for the holidays at The VORTEX. Darren Peterson brings his masterful juggling and unicycling, as well his gifted dog-training. This year’s production features our canine stars: the brilliant and talented Firefly, Dragonfly, and Coyote, along with our newest talented puppy in her Mutt-Cracker debut - Butterfly! 

The Mutt-Cracker (SWEET!) is written and directed by Melissa McKnight. Tyler Mabry’s live original score also includes Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker Suite with Vikki Schwarz on piano. Featuring Olivia Rose McCain as Clara, Nicole Boyd as Trudy Ballerina, Patricia Wappner as Mom, Monica Kurtz as Firefly, and Balyssa Bell as the multi-talented acro-artist. Lighting Design by Amy Lewis. Costume Design by Pam Fletcher Friday. Choreography by Blaise Ricin. Stage Management by Fernando Lara. Assistant Stage Management by Wolf Vepstas. Producing Artistic Director, Bonnie Cullum. 

Due to the extraordinary demand and popularity of this show, we strongly recommend advanced purchase.  

Performed INSIDE the theatre on the intimate Eloise Brooks Cullum Stage!

 

 

The Mutt-Cracker (SWEET!) is funded and supported in part by VORTEX Repertory Company, Six Square Austin’s Black Cultural District, and by the City of Austin Economic Development Department. We are a proud member of ATX Theatre.

 

Circus Chickendog is an Austin-based troupe that has been entertaining audiences for decades. Previously featured nationally on David Letterman, Pet Star, and Donny and Marie (Osmond), Circus Chickendog performs regularly in Austin and around Central Texas. Six-time Ironman Darren Peterson received a BS in Mathematics from the University of Texas at Austin after interrupting his college studies for two years to join the Royal Lichtenstein Circus where he was the main juggler and unicyclist. After graduation, Darren taught High School math for three years and worked as an editor of math textbooks for four years. While editing math books, Chicken Dog began winning Disc Dog competitions, and Darren combined her tricks with his circus skills and became so popular that he no longer had time to edit math books. Chickendog.net

 

https://www.circa.com/story/2017/09/19/whoa/darren-petersons-circus-chickendog-stars-rescue-dogs

20251222-a-christmas-carol-one-actor-ver.title: A Christmas Carol (one-actor version) by Austin Playhouse
20251222-a-christmas-carol-one-actor-ver.rss_description_html:
One Woman, over 30 characters, in 60 minutes!
​Join Austin Playhouse in celebrating the holiday season with Artistic Company Member and award-winning actress, storyteller, and author Bernadette Nason. Using Dickens’ own abridged version, Nason vividly brings the holiday classic to life, creating a magical experience for the whole family!​
​​Recommended for ages 8 and up!

20260115-the-wolf-you-feed-by-the-vortex.title: the wolf you feed by The Vortex
20260115-the-wolf-you-feed-by-the-vortex.rss_description_html:
The VORTEX presents the wolf you feed, a new play by Darcy Parker Bruce. Inspired by Where The Wild Things Are, this modern fable tells the story of Max and her relationship with a pack of chaotic punk-influenced wolves. Recently separated, Max has moved into the Shady Pines Motel at the feral edges of a national forest. Everything she used to know is transforming. Will the wolves lure Max into the wild to run with their pack?

 

Originally developed with Theatre Prometheus in Washington DC, the wolf you feed received virtual production during 2020 and production at Giant Wolf Theater at The Civic Theater in Tallaght, Dublin, Ireland in 2024. The VORTEX is thrilled to present this vibrant new play, recently published by Broadway Play Publishing. Directed by Chris Fontanes, VORTEX Associate Artistic Director. 

 

Featuring Rachel Hancock as Max. The Wolf pack features Phoenix Shaw as Pamplemousse, Angelina Castillo as Jet, Aurora Villarreal as Crackerjack, Mon Darter as Riffraf, and Pablo Munoz-Evers as Ajax. 

 

Scenic Design by Izzy Poehlmann; Costume and Mask Design by Aaron Flynn. Hair and Makeup Design by Ivy Vidal. Lighting Design by Amy Lewis. Sound Design by Johann Mahler. Original Score by Marine Komono. Movement Design by Robby Sciortino. Assistant Direction by Faith Sanders. Stage Management by Sarah Hogestyn. Assistant Stage Management by Suzanne Smith and Jamie Caroll. Graphic Design by SJ Anderson. Photography by Errich Petersen. Melissa McKnight, Managing Director. Bonnie Cullum, Producing Artistic Director.

About the Playwright: Darcy Parker Bruce is a graduate of the M.F.A. Playwriting program at Smith College and a 2025 MacDowell Fellow. Their work explores the intersections of queerness, adoption, environmental precarity, and American mythologies through interdisciplinary performance and research-based playwriting. Their practice is informed by critical conflict theory, which they use to examine power structures and hierarchies. They are the recipient of a 2017 Tennessee Williams Scholarship from the Sewanee Writers' Conference, a 2019 Lambda Literary Fellowship, and a 2023 writing residency at Gullkistan in Iceland. From 2022 to 2024, Bruce served as Writer in Residence at Interlochen Arts Academy. In 2018, they received the Association for Theatre in Higher Education's Judith Royer Award for Excellence in Theater for their play SOLDIER POET. They are currently working on THE BOOK OF A UNIVERSE INSIDE OF A UNIVERSE, a multigenerational performance work developed during their MacDowell residency that integrates archival research, adoption studies, queer temporality, and the ecological afterlives of war. In addition, Bruce is preparing for the upcoming publication of THE PIEDMONT PLAYS with Broadway Play Publishing, a four-play cycle confronting American ideology and the promise of "glory."

 

the wolf you feed is funded and supported in part by VORTEX Repertory Company, The Texas Commission on the Arts, The Shubert Foundation, and the City of Austin Economic Development Department. We are proud Core Members of the National New Play Network, Six Square-Austin’s Black Cultural District, ATX Theatre, and the Network of Ensemble Theatres.

20260212-yellow-face-by-ground-floor-the.title: Yellow Face by Ground Floor Theatre
20260212-yellow-face-by-ground-floor-the.rss_description_html:
Yellow Face by David Henry is a sharp, semi-autobiographical comedy that blurs the line between truth and fiction. Following Hwang himself as a character, the play tackles questions of race, identity, and representation in the American theatre with biting wit and satirical edge.

 

[image from cover of First Light Books]

20260410-rent-by-bastrop-opera-house.title: Rent by Bastrop Opera House
20260410-rent-by-bastrop-opera-house.rss_description_html:
Rent is a rock musical by Jonathan Larson, loosely based on the opera La bohème. It tells the story of impoverished young artists struggling to survive and create a life in Lower Manhattan's East Village, NYC , under the shadow of HIV/AIDS in the early 1990s.

This Pulitzer Prize and Tony-winning show features a moving score and powerful story that made Rent an instant classic.

20251205-stocking-stuffers-by-overtime-t.title: Stocking Stuffers by Overtime Theater
20251205-stocking-stuffers-by-overtime-t.venue_address: 4335 Vance Jackson Rd, #103-104 San Antonio, TX, 78230
20251205-stocking-stuffers-by-overtime-t.rss_description_html:
Stocking Stuffers 4 is stuffed full of holiday cheer and some mayhem as well.  This year we have 5 plays - Rudy, a queer Christmas story from the Overtime’s own Georgie Lee; Lights, Claws and Stuffed Hearts, a story about Christmas on the inside of a claw machine from Beck Dominguez; To Grandmother’s House, a story where family is a 6 letter word from the director Austin Escobedo; Two Merry Men and the Jolly Holly Heist, a Christmas heist story from San Antonio dance and movement legend Stephan Gaeth; and The Holiday Whistleblower, a workplace holiday tale from Isaiah Perkins.

 

The collection of plays is directed by Austin Escobedo who has been working with the Overtime for several years now as an actor and stage manager.  Stocking Stuffers 4 is his first time directing and we’re very excited about it!  Born and raised in San Antonio, Austin has also appeared on stage in a number of shows, including The Little Mermaid (Zion Theatre Group), Schrodinger's Catfish (Overtime), and The Bad Seed (The Point Theatre). Austin works as a vet tech for the Hill Country Animal League, and takes pride in his animal advocacy. 

 

Dedicated to providing original, innovative, and accessible entertainment at an affordable price, The Overtime Theater is a nonprofit organization with the mission of bringing “theater for the people” to the San Antonio community through new and thought-provoking stage productions.

Dedicated to providing original, innovative, and accessible entertainment at an affordable price, The Overtime Theater is a nonprofit organization with the mission of bringing “theater for the people” to the San Antonio community through new and thought-provoking stage productions.

20260226-noises-off-by-uvalde-grand-oper.title: Noises Off by Uvalde Grand Opera House
20260226-noises-off-by-uvalde-grand-oper.rss_description_html:
Get ready for chaos, comedy, and controlled mayhem! Noises Off is the ultimate backstage farce - a play within a play where everything that can go wrong does! From slamming doors to dropped lines to romantic mishaps, this fast-paced, laugh-out-loud masterpiece by Michael Frayn is a dream for actors who love big characters, physical comedy, and razor-sharp timing. Join us as we bring this hilarious rollercoaster of theatrical disaster to life - audition and be part of the madness behind the curtain!

Directed by Karen Miller Barnes

20260619-into-the-woods-by-lake-travis-m.venue_address: 5185 Lohmann's Ford Road Lago Vista, TX, 78645
20260619-into-the-woods-by-lake-travis-m.rss_description_html:
Lake Travis Music Theatre invites you to journey "Into the Woods" with us for our spectacular Summer 2026 production. This beloved musical weaves together classic fairy tales into a captivating story about wishes, choices, and the consequences that come with them.
Whether you're an experienced performer looking for your next role or a theatre enthusiast excited to support local arts, this enchanting production promises to be a highlight of our 2026 season.

20251205-a-tuna-christmas-by-city-theatr.title: A Tuna Christmas by City Theatre Company
20251205-a-tuna-christmas-by-city-theatr.rss_description_html:
“The worst Christmas of all was the year Hank got out of prison but didn’t bother to tell anybody.” - Tuna citizen, Bertha Bumiller

Everything's bigger in Texas, including the folks and family we all know and love! It’s Christmas Eve in the Lone Star state and radio station personalities Thurston Wheelis and Arles Struvie report local news on the Yuletide activities that have gripped their little whistle-stop of Tuna, the third smallest town in Texas, where the Lion's Club is too liberal, and Patsy Cline never dies. What’s to be done about Joe Bob Lipsey’s disastrous Christmas Carol pageant, a sabotaged yard-decorating contest, and a mysterious phantom on the loose and spreading havoc? With quick-change zaniness and quicksilver one-liners, CTC all-star actors Scot Friedman and Rick Smith introduce us to twenty-two of the wildest citizens of one zany town bringing all the “joy to the world” that make the holidays so special. Oh, holy night!

 

“A Tuna Christmas...everything you need it to be. The result is a magical Christmas experience with a sweet sense of nostalgia – theatre ‘comfort food’.” – Broadway World Austin.

"A hoot!" - The New York Times

"The hilarity never lets up." - The Village Voice

 A Tuna Christmas is the second in a series of comedies including the hits Greater Tuna, Red, White and Tuna, and Tuna Does Vegas each set in the fictional town of Tuna, Texas. The plays are at once an affectionate comment on small-town, southern life and attitudes, but also a withering satire of the same. For each show, the original writing is notable in that two men play the entire cast of over twenty characters of multiple genders, ages, and eccentricities. The first play, Greater Tuna, debuted in 1981 in Austin, Texas with A Tuna Christmas debuting in 1989. Jaston Williams and Joe Sears regularly tour the country to perform all four plays, with Ed Howard directing. Sears and Williams did command performances of both Greater Tuna and A Tuna Christmas at the White House for President George H.W. Bush and Barbara Bush.

 

A Tuna Christmas will once again pair up the dynamic duo Scot Friedman and Rick Smith, who appeared opposite of each other as Felix and Oscar in the highly successful The Odd Couple, as well as appearing together in the Austin Critic’s Table Award nominated The Seafarer and It’s Only a Play. The production is directed by Artistic Director Andy Berkovsky with original staging by Robyn Conner.

 

Beginning its 20th Season, City Theatre is an Austin-based, not-for-profit arts organization and is sponsored in part by the Austin Creative Alliance and the Cultural Arts Division of the City of Austin. Founded in 2006, the company has been recognized by the Austin Critics Table Awards, the B. Iden Payne Awards, the Central Texas Excellence in Theatre Awards, BroadwayWorld Austin, Central Texas Live Theatre, and has twice been voted “Best Theatre Company” by Austin American-Statesman’s Austin 360. CTC is dedicated to providing a quality, reputable, and diverse public theatre and stage entertainment experience that is accessible to all artists and the entire Austin community. CTC continues to offer its student and group discount ticket program for any show. Put a little theatre in your life!

20251218-the-summer-sauron-turned-pretty.title: The Summer Sauron Turned Pretty by Museum of Human Achievement
20251218-the-summer-sauron-turned-pretty.rss_description_html:
Hark! The herald Wizards sing! Glory to the Christmas Ring! The One Ring to rule the yule! To warm the heart of every holiday-loving hobbit, elf, and ent in Middle Earth! Whomever possesses the One Ring possesses the true spirit of Christmas. But on Christmas Eve of 2003, the Ring falls into the wrong hands! The only person that might save it is…a middle school girl writing a Lord of the Rings x Wicked fanfic fable for the ages in her Livejournal?! You may think you know the story of the One Ring, but if you're not at The Summer Sauron Turned Pretty, you're only getting one side of it.

Written by Roxy Castillo, Sam Mayer, Aira Juliet, Sawyer Stolz, and Megan Tabaque.

Costumes by Stephanie Page, Emily Gilardi, and Jess Bee.

Poster/Cup Art by Billie Buck.

Directed by Megan Tabaque. Cast TBA.

20251218-between-the-outlaw-and-the-rock.title: Between the Outlaw and the  Rock by Sam Bass Theatre Association
20251218-between-the-outlaw-and-the-rock.venue_address: 3300 East Palm Valley Blvd. Round Rock, TX, 78664
20251218-between-the-outlaw-and-the-rock.rss_description_html:
Written and directed by Central Texas resident and artist, Peg Patrone, BETWEEN THE OUTLAW & THE ROCK is a reworked revival of the sold-out run of the same title from February 2024. Featuring a cast of talented local actors, OUTLAW follows the stories of local legends A.W. Grimes, Sam Bass, and a plethora of other colorful characters that fill the new town at the Round Rock crossing along the Chisholm Trail. 


How much of this story is true and how much is Texas Tall Tale is up to you to decide!

 

For more information and to purchase tickets, visit https://our.show/sbtaoutlaw2025

20251121-rex-dexter-of-mars-by-extended-.title: Rex Dexter of Mars by Extended Run Players
20251121-rex-dexter-of-mars-by-extended-.venue_address: 4335 Vance Jackson Rd, #103-104 San Antonio, TX, 78230
20251121-rex-dexter-of-mars-by-extended-.rss_description_html:
Rex Dexter of Mars lovingly spoofs the science fiction films and radio shows of the 40s & 50s, with an extra shot of current political theater. Based on a comic book from the 1930s, this radio show returns us to a time when the good guys won & the bad guys lost.

Directed by Susan Brogdon.

Cast: Scott Liebowitz, Laurie Fitzpatrick, Sherri Small, Cindy Rodriguez Martinez, Michael Howard, Linda Ford, Diana Sarfin, Philip Marzec, Ted Gibbs, David White.

20260116-come-from-away-by-aurora-arts-t.rss_description_html: Based on the true story of when the small town of Gander, Newfoundland opened its doors to thousands of stranded passengers on September 11, 2001, Come From Away celebrates kindness, connection, and the extraordinary power of community.

20251205-a-merry-mary-cabaret-by-mary-mo.title: A Merry Mary Cabaret by Mary Moody Northen Theatre
20251205-a-merry-mary-cabaret-by-mary-mo.venue_name: Mary Moody Northen Theatre, St. Edward's University
20251205-a-merry-mary-cabaret-by-mary-mo.rss_description_html:
Back for its third year and quickly becoming a Hilltop holiday tradition, Mary Moody Northen Theatre's A Merry Mary Christmas Cabaret is a fun, festive cabaret filled with sparkle, laughs, and holiday cheer!

This year’s show features Nyla Watson (Broadway’s Waitress), alongside Austin favorites Andrew Cannata, Libby Detling, Jarret Mallon, and Anna Skidis Vargas. Under the music direction of Susan Finnigan, the show brings together a talented cast of alumni, faculty, and students—backed by a live band—for an unforgettable evening of music and merriment.

Enjoy your favorite holiday hits made famous by Bublé, Elvis, Sinatra, Dolly, and many more. 

Proceeds benefit the performing arts programs at St. Edward’s University, supporting student scholarships, hands-on learning, and MMNT productions.

20260320-the-games-afoot-by-the-stage.title: The Game's Afoot by The Stage
20260320-the-games-afoot-by-the-stage.html_synopsis: It‘s December 1936 and William Gillette, known world wide for his role on stage as Sherlock Holmes, and wounded from an attempt on his life at a performance, invites a few friends over for a weekend of revelry at his Connecticut mansion while he recovers. But when one of the guests is stabbed to death, the festivities in this isolated house of tricks and mirrors quickly turn dangerous. Then it’s up to Gillette himself, as he assumes the persona of his beloved Holmes, to track down the killer before there is another victim. In the vein of "whodunit" murder mysteries, the plot takes many twists and turns. In this Comedy Thriller, beginning with the intriguing opening mini play within a play to the surprise last scene a split second before final curtain you will find yourself swept along for a wild and funny ride. Gasp! “The Game’s Afoot is Murderously Funny!”

20251121-mary-poppins-by-the-theatre-com.title: Mary Poppins by The Theatre Company (TTC)
20251121-mary-poppins-by-the-theatre-com.venue_address: 3125 S. Texas Ave., Suite 500 (behind Joann Fabrics in the Tejas Center) Bryan, TX, 77802
20251121-mary-poppins-by-the-theatre-com.rss_description_html:
The two naughty Banks children, Jane (Rebekah Upton) and Michael (Parker Greer), live with their father George (David Case) and mother Winifred (Sarah Howe). Havingfrightened away previous nannies, a series of events results in the magical appearance of Mary Poppins (Lauren Moore), who promptly takes things in hand. Mary, along with her chimney-sweeping friend Bert (Korede Alabi in his TTC debut), helps the Banks family—and the rest of us—remember the importance of families, both close and extended; kindness; caring for one another; and remaining true to oneself.

Based on books by P. L. Travers and the iconic 1964 Disney film with Julie Andrews and

Dick Van Dyke, the show includes familiar tunes such as

“A Spoonful of Sugar,

” “Chim

Chim Cher-ee,

”

and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.

” MARY POPPINS: THE

BROADWAY MUSICAL was nominated for several prestigious awards. It remains one of

the longest-running Broadway shows.

20251118-sweeney-todd-by-texas-state-uni.title: Sweeney Todd by Texas State University Department of Theatre, Dance and Film
20251118-sweeney-todd-by-texas-state-uni.venue_address: 601 University Drive Texas State University San Marcos, TX, 78666
20251118-sweeney-todd-by-texas-state-uni.rss_description_html:
Texas State University's School of Theatre, Dance, and Film presents Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street, November 18-23, 2025, in the Patti Strickel Harrison Theatre.
 
Directed by Tom Delbello, with choreography by Brooke Cox, a senior in Musical Theatre, and music direction by Aimee Radics, this musical thriller will draw the audience into the sinister depths of Fleet Street. Haunting and riveting, this Sweeney Todd will keep audiences on the edge of their seats as the world around them transforms.
 
The story follows Sweeney Todd (Riley Thornton), a barber unjustly exiled, bent on vengeance. He forms a dark partnership with Mrs. Lovett (Malia McLellan), a proprietress of a failing pie shop. Together, they are a bloody success. Attend this reimagined tale featuring: Brendan Behm (Anthony Hope), Simone Straub-Clark (Johanna Barker), Bryan Fortunato (Tobias), Jordan Spena (Judge Turpin), Grisham Locke (Beadle Bamford), Ryan Sytsema (Adolfo Pirelli), and Hannah Jenkins (Beggar Woman).
 
On-stage musicians feature ensemble members Sophie Beck on violin, Kyler Huyse on concertina, Jerard Mosley II on percussion, and Hailey Truong on guitar.  Joining them is the ensemble comprised of Camila Abraham, Drew Barber, Zach Feeney, Michelle Ko, Caroline Davenport, Sebi Reyes-Farinas, Abbigayle Scott, Joe Schindler, and Ian Yamada.
 
This production reimagines Sweeney Todd as a dark, gripping tale told during a Newfoundland kitchen party in the early 1970s. A tight-knit ensemble transforms into storytellers, weaving a narrative of revenge, love, and obsession. Rooted in Newfoundland's tradition of exaggerated, humorous, and dark storytelling, the community becomes complicit in the events, highlighting their role in witnessing and perpetuating cycles of violence and injustice. Through their rich culture and traditions, the storytellers blend ominous melodies with the warmth of a coastal community.
 
The creative team includes Max Estudillo Cantú, scenic designer; Tiffany Yeager, costume designer; AJ Rose, lighting designer; Scott Murdock, sound designer; Colin Shay, technical director; and Emma Frances Frith, production stage manager.  
 
  • Director: Tom Delbello
  • Choreographer: Brooke Cox
  • Music Direction: Aimee Radics
  • Cast:
    • Sweeney Todd: Riley Thornton
    • Mrs. Lovett: Malia McLellan
    • Anthony Hope: Brendan Behm
    • Johanna Barker: Simone Straub-Clark
    • Tobias: Bryan Fortunato
    • Beggar Woman: Hannah Jenkins
    • Judge Turpin: Jordan Spena
    • Beadle Bamford: Grisham Locke
    • Adolfo Pirelli: Ryan Sytsema
    • On-Stage Musicians/Ensemble:
      • Sophie Beck, violin
      • Kyler Huyse, concertina
      • Jerard Mosley II, percussion
      • Hailey Truong, guitar
    • Ensemble: Camila Abraham, Drew Barber, Zach Feeney, Michelle Ko, Caroline Davenport, Sebi Reyes-Farinas, Abbigayle Scott, Joe Schindler, and Ian Yamada
 
Poster: Lauren Jurgemeyer

20251227-mutt-cracker-after-dark-by-the-.title: Mutt-Cracker (After Dark) by The Vortex
20251227-mutt-cracker-after-dark-by-the-.rss_description_html:
An adults-only roast of our belovéd holiday show

 

Twas the Saturday after Christmas

At The VORTEX late at night
And the last show of Mutt-Cracker
Had already taken flight

All the actors now were stirring
They had something up their sleeves
A bit of naughty fun
For adult time make-believe!

Join us later in the evening
For some vaudeville style delight
Puns and burlesque, even Krampus-
We’ll roast the show for just one night!

After 10 glorious years of performing the current incarnation of The Mutt-Cracker (SWEET!), many, MANY inside jokes have been made, alternative lyrics sung, and adult versions of scenes and songs have been conceived. For one night only, we have ‘unleashed’ the cast to perform a variety show that has been on their Xmas wish list for years – Mutt-Cracker (After Dark).

This is not your toddler’s Mutt-Cracker- 18 and up only. Join us for a night of raunchy fun as we travel parts of Doglandia never before seen! Journey with Clara as she explores the meaning of being a “Big” Little Girl. Sarcastic Cats, a Furry MC, Santa’s Little Helper, and more zany characters bump and grind through a magical winter wonderland. What tricks are Quillary Gooseton, PhD teaching us THIS time, and will Clara learn her lesson before the Krampus catches up with her?

20261009-ofrenda-by-austin-opera.title: Ofrenda by Austin Opera
20261009-ofrenda-by-austin-opera.venue_address: somewhere in Austin to be announced Austin, TX, 78700
20261009-ofrenda-by-austin-opera.rss_description_html:
Austin Opera’s first production in its new Butler Performance Center will be the October 2026 world premiere of Ofrenda, a 90-minute chamber opera performed in English and Spanish and funded by the Butler Fund for Spanish Programming. Developed over years of partnership with composer Jorge Sosa and librettist John de los Santos, this new work is a celebration of family, cultural memory, and Día de los Muertos traditions. Ofrenda will open the 2026–2027 season, representing a major milestone for the company—it is Austin Opera’s first commissioned work and the culmination of years of investment in developing new voices and stories that reflect Latinx communities, family, and tradition.

 

“I cannot think of a more ideal work to help us open the Butler Performance Center than Ofrenda, which has grown right here in Austin over the past three years through Jorge and John’s work in the Residency for Latinx Creatives,” said Annie Burridge, Austin Opera’s General Director & CEO. “Presenting this world premiere is both a celebration of artistic innovation and an act of community representation, highlighting the power of opera to honor heritage, inspire empathy, and bring people together across cultures.”

 

“The idea for Ofrenda came to me during COVID,” said composer Jorge Sosa. “I wanted to write a work that centered around healing and celebrated essential workers. I was thinking about the curanderas (traditional healers) in México and the mysticism that surrounds them. John de los Santos has been an incredible creative partner in developing the idiosyncrasies of the characters and the bilingual libretto. The opera reads like a hospital procedural show, mixed with a healthy dose of magical realism and high drama. The main character is Macaria, a custodian at a hospital who has an encounter with death (Señora). Moved by Macaria’s kindness, Señora sheds a tear of life into Macaria’s water bottle, giving her the power to heal anyone. But the price for such power will eventually catch up with her.”

 

“In Ofrenda, themes of remembrance, love, and healing are woven through a narrative that honors life’s enduring connections,” said Claudia Chapa, Austin Opera’s Associate Director of Artistic Operations and Curator of Hispanic & Latinx Programming. “The work resonates deeply in Austin, where more than one-third of residents identify as Hispanic or Latinx, and where Austin Opera has cultivated long-term relationships with the community through programs such as Concerts at the Consulate and the Residency for Latinx Creatives. As communities seek shared experiences that foster understanding and connection, Ofrenda offers a poignant reflection on the ties that bind families and cultures across generations.”

 

In 2023, Ofrenda was selected by Austin Opera to receive financial and workshop support through its Residency for Latinx Creatives, a program funded by the Butler Fund for Spanish Programming, which focuses on nurturing new works by Latinx artists. During the residency, Austin Opera’s artistic and administrative staff worked closely with Sosa and de los Santos. The team met regularly to provide feedback on libretto development and musical composition. A duet from the work premiered in November 2025 during Austin Opera’s Celebrate Opera! concert, introducing audiences to the new piece. In July 2026, a weeklong workshop will be held in Austin. Austin Opera will premiere the chamber version of the opera; however, a full orchestration is also being composed.

 

As Austin Opera’s new home for performance, rehearsal, and creative development, the Butler Performance Center is designed to serve as a dynamic cultural hub for Austin’s southeast community. The venue’s flexible 185-seat configuration offers an intimate and immersive setting—ideal for premiering a contemporary work like Ofrenda that emphasizes storytelling, emotional connection, and audience engagement. The venue’s size and location also make it ideal for reaching new and returning audiences from Austin’s culturally diverse southeast neighborhoods.

 

About the artists

Composer Jorge Sosa is a Mexican-born composer currently residing in New York City. He is Professor of Music at Molloy University and serves on the board of American Lyric Theater. The Boston Globe described the score of his opera Monkey: A Kung Fu Puppet Parable as “agile and entertaining, as befits such a journey,” praising a “seductive slow number sung by... Mara” and “a crackling vocal duel between Guan Yin and Mara.” Opera News described his telematic opera Alice in the Pandemic as “wildly imaginative, musically powerful and technically courageous,” and noted Sosa’s “broad stylistic palette [that] incorporated lyrical impassioned melodies, kooky carnival music, and efficient recitative.”

 

Librettist John de los Santos was commissioned in 2015 by Washington National Opera's American Opera Initiative with composer Christopher Weiss. The resulting piece, Service Provider, premiered at The Kennedy Center, and has since been performed across the country. His first collaboration with composer Clint Borzoni, When Adonis Calls, premiered under John’s direction at Asheville Lyric Opera. His second libretto with Borzoni, The Copper Queen, premiered as an award-winning feature film with Arizona Opera in 2021, and was staged by him the following year. Their third piece, The Christmas Spider, premiered under his direction at Opera Louisiane in 2023. He is a librettist with Minnesota Opera’s New Works Initiative, where he is currently adapting Stephen King’s Misery with composer Kamala Sankaram. As director/choreographer, he has also staged productions with Santa Fe Opera, Minnesota Opera, Wolf Trap Opera, Mostly Modern Festival, and the Manhattan School of Music. He served as Librettist-in-Residence for Opera Lab at The Juilliard School and currently teaches at the Yale School of Music.

20260313-lost-in-yonkers-by-bastrop-oper.title: Lost in Yonkers by Bastrop Opera House
20260313-lost-in-yonkers-by-bastrop-oper.rss_description_html: Two young brothers, Jay and Arty, are sent to live with their stern grandmother in 1942 after their mother's death. The story explores their adjustment to the new environment, which is complicated by their grandmother's harshness, their aunt Bella's childlike demeanor, and the presence of their Uncle Louie, a gangster. Themes of family, resilience, and the struggle for independence are central to the plot.

20251219-1000-forest-gorillas-in-kansas-.title: 1000 Forest Gorillas in Kansas by Teatro Vivo
20251219-1000-forest-gorillas-in-kansas-.rss_description_html:
Pastores, angels, devils, the baby Jesus - you know the story, right? Us too, or so we thought until everything goes wrong and we call on you, the Austin community, for help! Learn about this traditional Mexican folk play that is performed every year around Christmastime and participate in the retelling of the journey of the pastores or “shepherds.” 

Teatro Vivo, in collaboration with the Emma S. Barrientos Mexican American Cultural Center, presents our annual performance of “La Pastorela!” 

Pastores, ángeles, demonios, el niño Jesús... ¿Conoces la historia, verdad? Nosotros también, o eso creíamos hasta que todo sale mal y necesitamos de la ayuda de la comunidad de Austin. Conoce esta obra tradicional mexicana que se presenta cada año en épocas Navideñas y participa en el relato del viaje de los pastores. 

¡Contribuye a mantener viva esta tradición con esta representación de una gran historia!

20260219-other-desert-cities-by-stagecen.title: Other Desert Cities  by StageCenter Community Theatre
20260219-other-desert-cities-by-stagecen.rss_description_html: After a six-year absence, Brooke Wyeth returns to her family’s upscale Palm Springs home and Reaganesque life to celebrate the holidays. She brings with her more than just tidings of good cheer. Armed with a tell-all memoir that resurrects a tragic event in the family’s past, Brooke draws a line in the sand, daring her parents, brother, and aunt to cross it and confront their buried secrets. As the family unravels in the face of this explosive revelation, tensions soar, and loyalties are tested. With biting wit and razor-sharp insight and storytelling, Jon Robin Baitz’s award-winning drama promises a riveting exploration of family loyalty and love that will leave you on the edge of your seat.

20251217-frostbite-by-ventana-ballet.title: Frostbite by Ventana Ballet
20251217-frostbite-by-ventana-ballet.rss_description_html:
Ventana Ballet presents

Frostbite

The Witch Who Melted Winter

Executive Director, Producer, & Choreographer, AJ Garcia-Rameau

Assistant Director, Producer, & Choreographer, Navaji David Nava

An immersive holiday tale of magic, love, curse, & comedy. 

 

8 SHOWS:

Wednesday, December 17 - 7:00pm Thursday, December 18 - 7:00pm Friday, December 19 - 7:00pm Saturday, December 20 - 3:30 pm* & 6:00 pm & 8:30 pm Sunday, December 21 - 3:30 pm* & 6:00 pm*

*denotes Kids Interactive Shows!

 

GUEST ARRIVAL INFO:

- Pre-show "frostings" begin at the time listed- Please plan to arrive at the time listed on your ticket.- Performance begins approximately 30 minutes thereafter.- For the Evening Shows, the show run time is approximately 90 minutes, inlcuding a 15-minute intermission. - For the Kids Interactive Shows, the show run time is approximately 50 minutes, and there is no intermission.- Bring cash for the Winter Cocktail Bar and the Penguin Raffle!

 

AGE INFO & CONTENT ADVISORY:

Evening Shows: Show content is Rated PG-13. The requested age for all evening shows is 13 & up. Guests must be 21 years of age or older to drink. The production of Frostbite contains theatrical fog/haze, bright lighting effects, and some loud noises.

Kids Interactive Shows (Dec.20 & Dec.21 @ 3:30pm): The Kids Shows are abbreviated versions of the Evening Shows, and they are specifically customized for ages 12 & below, including on-stage dancing activities and photo opportunities with the cast after the show! Show runtime for the Kids Shows is approximately 50 minutes with no intermission. Please note that each child must have a Child Ticket, and each child must be accompanied by an adult with an Adult Ticket. (Multiple children can be accompanied by one adult.)

 

TICKETS:

Evening Shows:VIP Front Row Seats [Yellow Zone] $50VIP Bar-Height Stools [Green Zone] $40General Admission Seats [Blue Zone] $30Plus Sales Tax & Ticketing Platform Fee**Scroll down to see the seat map**Interactive Kids Shows:Adult Ticket $35*Child Ticket $20Plus Sales Tax & Ticketing Platform Fee*Please note that each child must have a Child Ticket, and each child must be accompanied by an adult with an Adult Ticket. (Multiple children can be accompanied by one adult.)EARLY BIRD TICKET PRICING Use early bird promo code “penguins” (valid through November 25th)

LOCATION:

EAST SIDE PERFORMING ARTS (ESPA)979 Springdale Rd, Austin, TX 78702

 

Meet the Official Cast of Frostbite 2025:

Navaji David Nava - Señor Snow AJ Garcia-Rameau - Lumira, the Ice Unicorn Colleen DeForrest - The Witch Taylor Woolums - Carol, The Spider Sydney Galier - The Polar Bear Kayla Hoover - Noelle, The Village Girl Aidan DeWitt - Harold, The Penguin Shepherd Emily Lofton - Icicle, Penguin Arianna Sotero - Icicle, Penguin Mia Moi - Icicle, Penguin Penelope Morejon Molina - Icicle, Penguin Shelby Higley - Penguin Angel Cadavid - Penguin Bradi Nelson - Penguin Siobhan Klugh - Penguin* Rania Kandil - Guest Artist (Bellydance)* Monica Caivano, Gustavo Simplis, & Esquina Tango - Guest Artists (Tango)* Sivakami Sreenivasan & Temple of Fine Arts - Guest Artists (Bharatanatyam)** Stephanie Keeton - Guest Artist (Flamenco)* Mia Dedear - Guest Artist (Chinese Classical Dance)

*Guest Artists appear in the Evening Shows only, not the Kids Interactive Shows **Stephanie Keeton appearing December 18-21 evening shows, only.

WITCH’S FAQ’s:

Seasons Greetings, Distinguished Guests!

Your favorite Hallow-Queen here, and if you recall…I’m no basic witch. If you remember what happened during UNDEAD, then you know I *must* reset the balance and stir up some mischief. I assure you, this is snow joke.

All of these holiday decorations and parties make me sick! I hate winter, and I must take things into my own cold hands. Oh, don’t be snow dramatic! It’s going to be perfectly splendid. How about a little winteractive game?

I'm remarkably excited to take you with me on this journey from the UNDEAD Woods (where we last left off) and into Winterland where you will meet Señor Snow, The Polar Bear, and Lumira, the Ice Unicorn. Together, they uphold the balance and sustain the harmony of Winterland… a “little town,  quiet village”… like I said, makes me sick! The Village People don’t snow what’s coming their way, as they are busy preparing for the annual Snowflake Ball. Well pardon the winterruption, this gonna be as eezy freezy as taking a snowball from a penguin.

Glisten up! Please watch your ticket confirmation email closely for further information about what to wear, where to park, event schedule, etc. You should receive this wintery note a couple of days before the show.

In the meantime, I’m sure you’re wondering what the elf is going on… I’ll answer your questions below…

  • Q: Where is the venue? •
Witch Says: Frost and foremost…set your GPS to ESPA, also known as "East Side Performing Arts," located at 979 Springdale Rd., Austin, TX 78702. If you remember from October, the entrance to the UNDEAD Woods is at the back of the complex. 

 • Q: What time should I be there? •
Witch Says: You and your snowmen should plan to arrive at the time on your ticket, snow sooner, snow later!

• Q: Where do I sit? •
Witch Says: The ticket you purchased is for a seat in either in the Yellow Zone (VIP Front Row Seating), or the Green Zone (VIP Bar Stool Seating), or the Blue Zone (General Admission Tiered Riser Seating). Each zone is frost come, frost served. You’ll have the opportunity to grab your seats when the time is right (you’ll snow exactly what that means when you get here).

  • Q: What time does the show start, and how long does it last? •
Witch Says: The blizzard will begin approximately 30 minutes after the time on your ticket. The forecast says this blizzard will last approximately 90-minutes, with one 15-minute intermission.   

• Q: What’s going on before the show? •
Witch Says: Those darn Penguins hosting a Penguin Raffle with lots of ho-ho-holiday goodies. You can also check out the Make-Your-Own-Snowflake Station and Winter Cocktail Bar while you wait for wintery invitation to go find your seats. Bring cash or venmo to buy your $5 tickets. (BTW! All proceeds go towards artist paychecks!) 

 • Q: Where do I park? •
Witch Says: Witch, please. Note that the Winter Cocktail Bar is wide open, and we invite you to stay frosty, my friends, SO! we strongly encourage taking a Ride Share. If you do decide to drive, however, you can park your broomsticks behind the building at East Side Performing Arts (979 Sprindgale Rd., Suite 815, Austin, TX 78702).  Enter the parking lot near Black Feather Vintage; drive around to the back of the building. Head up the stairs towards Ground Floor Theatre; make a right, and head all the way down. The entrance to the UNDEAD Woods will be on your left 

 • Q: What do I wear? • 
Witch Says: I say…. if you’ve got it, haunt it. I love a good Halloween costume in the Winter—freeze the day! Otherwise, you can join the Village People of Winterland and wear you winter-best, in preparation for the annual Snowflake Ball.

 • Q: What is the recommended age and content in this show? •
Witch Says:
For the Evening Shows – Show content is Rated PG-13. The requested age for all evening shows is 13 & up. Guests must be 21 years of age or older to drink. The production of Frostbite contains theatrical fog/haze, bight lighting effects, and some loud noises.
For the Kids Interactive Shows (Dec.20 & Dec.21 @ 3:30pm) – The Kids Shows are abbreviated versions of the Evening Shows, and they are specifically customized for ages 12 & below, including on-stage dancing activities and photo opportunities with the cast after the show! Show runtime for the Kids Shows is approximately 50 minutes with no intermission. Please note that each child must have a Child Ticket, and each child must be accompanied by an adult with an Adult Ticket. (Multiple children can be accompanied by one adult.) 

• Q: How close will the characters get to me? •
Witch Says: My friends here in the Undead Woods are tricksters, but the Winterland folks are little sweeter (until I have something to say about it, muahaha). They all like to get up-close-and-personal, but they will not touch you. Please, witches, feel free to winter-act, but don’t touch them! 

 • Q: Will there be a bar? • 
Witch Says: The Winter Cocktail Bar is poppin’ off this year (hey thanks, Tito). Bring some cash! I checked the spellbook, and the cauldron punch is witchin.’  

 • Q: Can we buy tickets at the door? • 
Witch Says: We will sell some limited tickets at the door, but it’s cheaper to buy online in advance! I definitely recommend buying in advance, though, since this brand new show will SELL OUT! Buy your tickets online NOW, or else we may have to say, “Boo, Felicia!”  

 • Q: Is the venue wheelchair accessible? • 
Witch Says: Both the venue access and the seating are located on the ground level. Give us a heads up (info@ventanaballet.com) if you need us to designate some specific wheelchair spots for your party. We know that not all witches ride brooms, so allow us to reserve a spot for you to get the most fa-boo-lous views. 

Some parting words from the Witch…

We’re off to see the blizzard.
Get ready for all hail to break loose.

- THE WITCH

20251229-a-hill-country-home-companion-b.title: A Hill Country Home Companion by Wimberley Players
20251229-a-hill-country-home-companion-b.rss_description_html:
Start your New Year on a high note with two nights of original live radio magic that supports our beloved local theatre! This unique benefit show returns, celebrating the humor, heart, and quirks of life in the Texas Hill Country through an expanded lineup of live radio sketches crafted by local playwrights and brought to life by our talented cast and crew! 
Enjoy a night of fancy dress, red carpet, local friends and of course, live music from our local favorites, The Jazz Messenger Boys!

Henry decides to rise to the challenge and mold Eliza into a lady by way of perfecting her speech and etiquette.

20260222-follies-2026-the-ageing-of-aqua.title: Follies 2026 - The Ageing of Aquarius by Actors and Theatre Arts Guild, Sun City
20260222-follies-2026-the-ageing-of-aqua.venue_name: The Retreat Amenity Center, Sun City
20260222-follies-2026-the-ageing-of-aqua.rss_description_html:
An evening filled with music, humor and a groovy amount of fun. Join us as we take a "trip" back to the late 1960's, when most of us were just searching for peace, love, harmony and understanding. But, mostly the "love part".

DIRECTED BY SUZANNE ALFORD AND ROBB HALES

MUSIC DIRECTOR: ROSEMARY GUTHERIDGE-ASST. MUSIC DIR: JEFF MELSON

20261120-its-a-wonderful-life-the-musica.title: It's A Wonderful Life, the musical by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20261120-its-a-wonderful-life-the-musica.rss_description_html: Frank Capra’s film classic has been brought to vibrant theatrical life through the remarkable collaboration of Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winner Sheldon Harnick and Grammy and Emmy Award-winner Joe Raposo. The story of George Bailey and his wonderful life in Bedford Falls remains a timeless fable of dreams, disillusionment and the power of love. An uplifting chronicle of the extraordinary lives of ordinary folk, A Wonderful Life exhilarates the mind and heart as it celebrates the innate goodness in us all.

20261016-the-second-to-last-chance-ladie.title: The Second-to-Last Chance Ladies League by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20261016-the-second-to-last-chance-ladie.rss_description_html:
In this delightful and uproarious comedy, four best friends—Libby Ruth, Deedra, Monette, and Charlie—each yearning to change their life before it’s too late, return to their beloved Laurelton Oaks, a wedding venue they know well—in one of their cases, all too well.

With Deedra’s purchase of the stately venue the others rally around her, and the business is ingeniously reimagined as “Occasionally Yours,” an events center for all kinds of fresh, new celebratory gatherings. With these women so involved in each other’s lives, what could possibly go wrong? Basically, almost everything, what with Monette—flashy, vivacious, and self-involved—careening through a comic minefield of yet another divorce; salt-of-the-earth, tree-hugging Charlie struggling to survive her late-arriving mid-life crisis; and Libby Ruth—sweet, guileless but absolutely nobody’s fool—choosing to return to college and at the same time finding herself overwhelmed by the rebirth of her husband’s libido that keeps getting in the way of her studies. Meanwhile, headstrong Deedra is doing her dead-level best to fend off the eagle-eyed control issues of one practical and unflappable Sedalia Ellicott, the former owner, who refuses to relinquish the reins and exit gracefully.

In the course of one ferociously funny year, they joyfully throw themselves into hosting all manner of events—baby showers, bachelorette parties, memorial services—where everything that can go awry does. They are even compelled to participate in, yes, another last-minute, improbable wedding. In this side-splitting sequel to ALWAYS A BRIDESMAID and stand-alone play in its own right—these tenacious women endure these laugh-out-loud adventures in hospitality and grow closer than ever as they tickle your funny bone and definitely capture your heart—again.

20261002-pretty-woman-the-musical-by-geo.title: Pretty Woman, the musical by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20261002-pretty-woman-the-musical-by-geo.rss_description_html:
Based on the classic film starring Julia Roberts and Richard Gere, Pretty Woman: The Musical, features an original score by Grammy Award-winner Bryan Adams (“Summer of ’69,” “Everything I Do”) and his longtime songwriting partner Jim Vallance, and a book by the movie’s legendary director Garry Marshall and screenwriter J.F. Lawton.

Once upon a time in the late ’80s, unlikely soulmates Vivian and Edward overcame all odds to find each other and themselves. Experience the moments you love from the movie – and get to know these iconic characters in a whole new way. It’s a dazzling theatrical take on a love story for the ages. Pretty Woman: The Musical lifts your spirits and lights up your heart.

20260821-and-then-there-were-none-by-geo.title: And Then There Were None by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20260821-and-then-there-were-none-by-geo.rss_description_html: Ten strangers are summoned to a remote island. All that the guests have in common is a wicked past they’re unwilling to reveal and a secret that will seal their fate… for each has been marked for murder. As the weather turns and the group is cut off from the mainland, the bloodbath begins; one by one, they are brutally murdered in accordance with the lines of a sinister nursery rhyme about “Ten Little Soldier Boys.”

20260724-42nd-street-by-georgetown-palac.title: 42nd Street by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20260724-42nd-street-by-georgetown-palac.rss_description_html: Come along and listen to the lullaby of Broadway! 42nd Street celebrates Broadway, Times Square and the magic of show biz with wit, humor and pizzazz. At the height of the Great Depression, aspiring chorus girl Peggy Sawyer comes to the big city from Allentown PA, and soon lands her first big job in the ensemble of a glitzy new Broadway show. But just before opening night, the leading lady breaks her ankle. Will Peggy be able to step in and become a star? The score is chock-full of Broadway standards, including “You’re Getting To Be A Habit With Me,” “Dames,” “We’re In the Money,” “Lullaby of Broadway,” “Shuffle Off to Buffalo” and “Forty-Second Street.”

But just before opening night, the leading lady breaks her ankle. Will Peggy be able to step in and become a star? The score is chock-full of Broadway standards, including “You’re Getting To Be A Habit With Me,” “Dames,” “We’re In the Money,” “Lullaby of Broadway,” “Shuffle Off to Buffalo” and “Forty-Second Street.”

20260619-every-brilliant-thing-by-george.title: Every Brilliant Thing by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20260619-every-brilliant-thing-by-george.rss_description_html:
You’re six years old. Mum’s in hospital. Dad says she’s “done something stupid.” She finds it hard to be happy. So you start to make a list of everything that’s brilliant about the world. Everything that’s worth living for.

  1. Ice cream.
  2. Kung Fu movies.
  3. Burning things.
  4. Laughing so hard you shoot milk out your nose.
  5. Construction cranes.
  6. Me.

You leave it on her pillow. You know she’s read it because she’s corrected your spelling. Soon, the list will take on a life of its own. 

A play about depression and the lengths we will go to for those we love.

20260529-jesus-christ-superstar-by-georg.title: Jesus Christ Superstar by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20260529-jesus-christ-superstar-by-georg.rss_description_html:
What’s the buzz? The first musical by Tim Rice and Andrew Lloyd Webber to be produced for the professional stage, Jesus Christ Superstar has wowed audiences for more than 50 years. A timeless work, the rock opera is set against the backdrop of an extraordinary and universally known series of events but seen, unusually, through the eyes of Judas Iscariot. Loosely based on the gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, Superstar follows the last week of Jesus Christ’s life. The story, told entirely through song, explores the personal relationships and struggles between Jesus, Judas, Mary Magdalene, his disciples, his followers and the Roman Empire.

The iconic 1970s rock score contains such well-known numbers as “Superstar,” “I Don’t Know How to Love Him” and “Gethsemane.” A true global phenomenon and perfect pick for schools, community theaters and professionals alike, Superstar continues to touch new generations of audiences and performers.

20260320-oklahoma-by-georgetown-palace-t.title: Oklahoma! by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20260320-oklahoma-by-georgetown-palace-t.rss_description_html: Oklahoma! is the first musical written by the duo of Rodgers and Hammerstein. The musical is based on Lynn Riggs’s 1931 play Green Grow the Lilacs. Set in farm country outside the town of Claremore, Western Territory, in 1906, it tells the story of farm girl Laurey Williams and her courtship by two rival suitors, cowboy Curly McLain and the sinister and frightening farmhand Jud Fry.

20260213-swing-by-georgetown-palace-thea.title: Swing! by Georgetown Palace Theatre
20260213-swing-by-georgetown-palace-thea.rss_description_html: It shattered ethnic and cultural barriers, generating specialty styles such as Jive, Swing, Lindy Hop, West Coast Swing, and Hip-Hop Swing. SWING! celebrates this remarkable diversity to the beat of the most exhilarating songs of the period. But as this enthralling song-and-dance show makes abundantly clear, swing was never a time or place — it has always been a state of mind!

20260206-the-mountaintop-by-georgetown-p.rss_description_html: The Mountaintop by American playwright Katori Hall is a fictional depiction of Martin Luther King Jr.’s last night on earth set entirely in Room 306 of the Lorraine Motel on the eve of his assassination in 1968.

20260529-the-robber-bridegroom-by-alchem.title: The Robber Bridegroom by Alchemy Theatre Company
20260529-the-robber-bridegroom-by-alchem.venue_address: 1510 Toomey Road Zach Theatre Austin, TX, 78704
20260529-the-robber-bridegroom-by-alchem.rss_description_html:
Set in 18th century Mississippi, it is an irreverent, playful, and at times raunchy tribute to the con men, hucksters and charlatans that created our great nation — a Southern-fried Robin Hood tale of Jamie Lockhart, a dangerous, handsome, backwoods rogue who’s a gentleman by day and a bandit by night. When he falls for the beautiful daughter of the county’s wealthiest planter, his world is turned upside down. Throw in an evil stepmother who is intent on Rosamund’s demise, her pea-brained henchman and a hostile talking head-in-a-trunk, and you have a high-energy mix of witty dialogue and rollicking barn dance.

THE ROBBER BRIDEGROOM has its origins in a Brothers Grimm fairytale and was adapted by beloved writer Eudora Welty into a novella of the same name in 1942. It is a bawdy fairytale with book and lyrics by Alfred Uhry, the Pulitzer Prize-winning author of Driving Miss Daisy, and a score by Robert Waldman. With one of the only genuine bluegrass scores ever heard in a Broadway musical, the toe-tapping, knee-slapping THE ROBBER BRIDEGROOM combines themes of love, deception and adventure.

Music by Robert Waldman

Book and Lyrics by Alfred Uhry

Based on the novella The Robber Bridegroom by Eudora Welty

Directed by Michael Cooper

Choreographed by Noah Wood

Musical Direction by Ellie Jarrett Shattles

Produced by Marnie Near

 

[poster art by Paige Freeman @paigefreemanhoover]

20260305-the-front-page-musical-by-benaj.title: The Front Page (musical) by Benajah T. Baskin
20260305-the-front-page-musical-by-benaj.rss_description_html:
This new musical adaptation of the classic play "The Front Page" marries comedy with political intrigue, interrogating what truth means when fact becomes suspect.
When her ex-husband, Walter Burns, comes back into her life, intrepid ex-reporter Hildy Johnson has to chose between her past as a journalist or her future as a wife.
 
Playscript and Production Staged by Benajah T. Baskin

Based on the Play of the Same Name by Ben Hecht and Charles MacArthur with Songs by Irving Berlin.
PG-13 for some language.

20251228-capote-and-faulk-remember-chris.title: Capote and Faulk Remember Christmas by Ad Hoc Productions
20251228-capote-and-faulk-remember-chris.venue_address: 4335 Vance Jackson Rd, #103-104 San Antonio, TX, 78230
20251228-capote-and-faulk-remember-chris.rss_description_html:
The memories of two master storytellers show how the spirit of sharing and generosity, especially in times of hardship, brings out the true meaning of fellowship that lives in us at this special time of year.

“A Christmas Memory” by Truman Capote & “Christmas Story” by John Henry Faulk. Readings by Michael Howard and Linda Ford

"A Christmas Memory" is a short story by Truman Capote, first published in Mademoiselle magazine in 1956, that reflects on the author's childhood memories of Christmas in rural Alabama twenty years earlier. It is the touching tale of a seven-year-old boy named Buddy and his elderly cousin, Sook, as they share a special bond and engage in holiday traditions and hardships, emphasizing themes of friendship and giving.

John Henry Faulk was a gifted American folklorist, storyteller and former radio show host, known for his influential work in media and his successful lawsuit against the entertainment industry that helped end the Hollywood blacklist. His “Christmas Story” is a nostalgic tale told by a barefoot boy whom the narrator encounters on the road the day after Christmas. The story, originally broadcast in 1974 for the program “Voices in the Wind,” is about two poor Texas families finding joy during the holidays by sharing their first-ever Christmas.

20260115-aurora-by-amy-abrigo.title: Aurora by Amy Abrigo
20260115-aurora-by-amy-abrigo.venue_address: 1900 Fredericksburg Rd Suite 101 San Antonio, TX, 78201
20260115-aurora-by-amy-abrigo.rss_description_html:
Join us for a FREE public reading of Aurora, a new one-woman show written and performed by Amy Abrigo.Aurora is a deeply personal work inspired by Amy’s grandmother and her journey with Alzheimer’s. Through memory, storytelling, and love, the play explores the stories we carry — and what happens when they begin to slip away.

This reading takes place on January 15, 2026 — Aurora’s birthday, 90 years to the day after she was born. It is both a celebration of her life and a reflection on memory, legacy, and the people who shape us.“This story is about my grandmother — but it’s also about memory, and all the stories we hold inside us that are erased when we are gone. The play is called Aurora, named for her. We will be reading it on her birthday. I hope you will join us.”
— Amy Abrigo

20260514-kiss-me-kate-by-waco-civic-thea.title: Kiss Me, Kate by Waco Civic Theatre
20260514-kiss-me-kate-by-waco-civic-thea.rss_description_html:
Broadway meets the Bard in Kiss Me, Kate — the Tony Award-winning masterpiece where Shakespearean comedy, backstage drama, and showbiz chaos explode into musical magic.

 

When a feuding divorced couple is forced to play opposite each other in a musical version of The Taming of the Shrew, the result is pure theatrical fireworks. Tempers ignite, passions flare, and the line between performance and reality disappears in a whirl of wit, romance, and perfectly timed disaster.

 

Armed with Cole Porter’s legendary score — including “Too Darn Hot,” “Brush Up Your Shakespeare,” and “So in Love” — Kiss Me, Kate delivers the full Broadway experience: dazzling choreography, knockout vocals, and the timeless thrill of live theatre at its boldest.

 

Critics call it “a musical comedy masterpiece” and “a love letter to everything that makes theatre irresistible.”

20260409-the-odd-couple-female-version-b.title: The Odd Couple - Female Version by Waco Civic Theatre
20260409-the-odd-couple-female-version-b.rss_description_html:
Neil Simon’s classic comedy gets a fresh, hilarious twist in The Odd Couple: Female Edition! Set in the 1980s, this sharp-witted and fast-paced adaptation follows the mismatched friendship of Olive Madison, a laid-back, carefree slob, and Florence Unger, a neurotic perfectionist. When Florence’s marriage falls apart, she moves in with Olive, and the result is pure comedic chaos—think mismatched roommates, a disastrous dinner party, and plenty of quick-fire banter.

With its timeless humor and unforgettable characters, this comedy proves that the magic of theatre lies in its ability to make us laugh, relate, and appreciate the quirks that make us who we are!

20260320-dear-edwina-by-waco-civic-theat.title: Dear Edwina by Waco Civic Theatre
20260320-dear-edwina-by-waco-civic-theat.rss_description_html: Dear Edwina is a charming family musical by Zina Goldrich (music) and Marcy Heisler (book & lyrics) about 13-year-old advice-giver Edwina Spoonapple, who hosts her own garage show to share wisdom from letters, hoping to impress a talent scout at the Kalamazoo Advice-a-palooza Festival. It's told as a "show-within-a-show" and features catchy songs addressing life lessons, friendship, and growing up, making it popular for both kids and adults

20260212-9-to-5-the-musical-by-waco-civi.title: 9 to 5, the Musical by Waco Civic Theatre
20260212-9-to-5-the-musical-by-waco-civi.rss_description_html:
When three overworked, underestimated women decide they’ve had enough of their sexist, egotistical boss, they turn the workplace upside-down in a whirlwind of wit, rebellion, and friendship. What follows is a raucous, heart-thumping reminder that when we stand together, change isn’t just possible — it’s unstoppable.

 

Filled with dazzling energy, unforgettable songs, and the unmistakable sparkle of Dolly’s humor and heart, 9 to 5: The Musical celebrates the dreamers, the doers, and everyone who’s ever dared to rewrite the rules.

 

Waco’s own Holly Tucker steps into Dolly Parton’s high heels as Doralee Rhodes — and she’s every bit as unforgettable!

20260117-a-grand-night-for-singing-by-wa.title: A Grand Night for Singing by Waco Civic Theatre
20260117-a-grand-night-for-singing-by-wa.rss_description_html:
Step into the spellbinding world of Rodgers & Hammerstein, where music and storytelling weave together to create pure theatrical magic! A Grand Night for Singing is a dazzling celebration of the legendary duo’s most cherished songs, reimagined with fresh arrangements and a contemporary twist.

Join us for an unforgettable night where the stage comes alive with soaring harmonies, sweeping emotions, and the magic of theatre—reminding us all why we fell in love with musicals in the first place.

20260416-the-great-god-pan-by-trinity-un.title: The Great God Pan by Trinity University
20260416-the-great-god-pan-by-trinity-un.venue_address: Trinity University One Trinity Place San Antonio, TX, 78212-7200
20260416-the-great-god-pan-by-trinity-un.html_synopsis: Jamie’s life in Brooklyn seems just fine: a beautiful girlfriend, a budding journalism career, and parents who live just far enough away. But when a possible childhood trauma comes to light, lives are thrown into a tailspin.  Unsettling and deeply compassionate, THE GREAT GOD PAN tells the intimate tale of what is lost and won when a hidden truth is unloosed into the world.

20260612-romeo-and-juliet-by-camille-lig.title: Romeo and Juliet by Camille Lightner Playhouse
20260612-romeo-and-juliet-by-camille-lig.rss_description_html: In this classic show ROMEO AND JULIET an age-old vendetta between two powerful families erupts into bloodshed. A group of masked Montagues risk further conflict by gatecrashing a Capulet party. A young lovesick Romeo Montague falls instantly in love with Juliet Capulet, who is due to marry her father’s choice, the County Paris. With the help of Juliet’s nurse, the women arrange for the couple to marry the next day, but Romeo’s attempt to halt a street fight leads to the death of Juliet’s own cousin, Tybalt, for which Romeo is banished. What will happen then to our star-crossed lovers?

20260508-heathers-musical-by-camille-lig.title: Heathers, musical by Camille Lightner Playhouse
20260508-heathers-musical-by-camille-lig.rss_description_html:
Based on the cult classic film of the same name, Heathers is the story of Veronica Sawyer, a senior at the fictional Westerberg High. Veronica longs to be cool like the clique of it-girls that runs Westerberg: the unaffected, unattainable Heathers. Unfortunately, in addition to awesome levels of popularity, the Heathers are also cruel, choosing to mock and bully their kingdom into submission. 

Directed by Dylan Mendoza

20260320-anna-in-the-tropics-by-camille-.title: Anna in the Tropics by Camille Lightner Playhouse
20260320-anna-in-the-tropics-by-camille-.rss_description_html: Shimmering with passion and poetry, the Pulitzer Prize-winning drama ANNA IN THE TROPICS weaves the tale of a Cuban-American cigar factory in 1929 Florida where cigars are still rolled by hand and “lectors” are employed to transport and inspire the workers as they toil on the factory floor. As a handsome and debonair new lector reads the words of Tolstoy’s Anna Karenina, the lives of the workers begin to parallel the novel. Old traditions and new ways collide while longing, love, and betrayal spark a volatile flame that signals the end of an era.

20260213-guys-and-dolls-by-camille-light.title: Guys and Dolls by Camille Lightner Playhouse
20260213-guys-and-dolls-by-camille-light.rss_description_html:
Guys and Dolls is a musical romantic comedy involving the unlikeliest of Manhattan pairings: a high-rolling gambler and a puritanical missionary, and a showgirl dreaming of the straight-and-narrow and a crap game manager who is anything but. Set in the Manhattan of Damon Runyon’s short stories, Guys and Dolls tells of con-man Nathan Detroit’s efforts to find new life for his illegal, but notorious, crap game. Guys and Dolls takes us from the bustle of Times Square, to the dance clubs of Havana, to the sewers of New York City as it demonstrates the great lengths to which a guy will go when he truly falls in love with a “doll.” 

Music and Lyrics by Frank Loesser
Book by Jo Swerling and Abe Burrows

20260618-dear-dickies-by-hyde-park-theat.title: Dear DIckies by Hyde Park Theatre
20260618-dear-dickies-by-hyde-park-theat.rss_description_html:
A love/business letter to Dickies workwear written and performed by Robin Chotzinoff.

Dear Dickies chronicles, through slides and stories, her attempt to become a Dickies brand ambassador. And also her attempt to clean out her closet, IRL and metaphorically.

 Photo by Katie Rose Gurkin.

20260219-witch-by-hyde-park-theatre.title: Witch by Hyde Park Theatre
20260219-witch-by-hyde-park-theatre.rss_description_html:
Wherever I go people are like “Oh there’s the witch of Edmonton”

they’re like “where are you going witch”

they’re like “my cow took sick, why’d you do that”

and then the whispering!

Say I’m in line at the well, with everybody else.

If I turn around, the whispering stops. Dead silence.

You don’t think I know what you’re saying about me?

 

The village thinks old Elizabeth is a witch. But when a charming, affable Devil arrives, only Elizabeth—not the rich young man devoted to Morris dancing (and another, secret thing); not his ruthlessly ambitious adopted brother; not the village girl he’s stringing along—only Elizabeth cannot be tempted . . . maybe.

And maybe that’s what the Devil can’t resist.

If you’ve ever looked around and thought, “Maybe it’s time to burn it all down and start fresh”—then this is the play for you.: Jen Silverman’s darkly funny and very modern take on the 1621 Jacobean play The Witch of Edmonton.

The HPT production features Chase Brewer, Katherine Catmull, Jon Cook, Steve Guntli, Amara Johnson, and Rupert Reyes. Directed by Ken Webster.

20260130-hamlet-by-gaslight-baker-theatr.title: Hamlet by Gaslight Baker Theatre
20260130-hamlet-by-gaslight-baker-theatr.rss_description_html:
Hamlet is a thrilling, emotionally charged story of secrets, power, and the moment when everything changes. When a young prince learns a truth he can’t unhear, he’s pulled into a dangerous game inside a royal court where loyalty is fragile and nothing is as it seems. Full of sharp wit, haunting beauty, and unforgettable characters, Hamlet asks how far we’re willing to go for justice: and what it costs when we hesitate. This is Shakespeare at his most intense, urgent, and alive!

Directed by A. Jason Jones

20260113-fronterafest-by-hyde-park-theat.title: FronteraFest by Hyde Park Theatre
20260113-fronterafest-by-hyde-park-theat.rss_description_html:
"The fringe theater event of the Southwest!"-Austin American Statesman

That’s right: it’s time to heat up your winter nights again with the 31st season of FronteraFest at Hyde Park Theatre. The Short Fringe, BYOV, and Mi Casa--as always and ever, FronteraFest is five weeks of alternative, offbeat, new, and just plain off-the-wall fringe theatre. Too bad there's no actual way to expect the unexpected, because that is your only hope.

 

 

FronteraFest is produced in collaboration with ScriptWorks,, a group dedicated to supporting emerging playwrights and developing new dramatic works.

20260529-shrek-the-musical-by-the-theatr.title: Shrek The Musical by The Theatre Company (TTC)
20260529-shrek-the-musical-by-the-theatr.venue_address: 3125 S. Texas Ave., Suite 500 (behind Joann Fabrics in the Tejas Center) Bryan, TX, 77802
20260529-shrek-the-musical-by-the-theatr.rss_description_html:
"Once upon a time, there was a little ogre named Shrek...." And thus begins the tale of an unlikely hero who finds himself on a life-changing journey alongside a wisecracking Donkey and a feisty princess who resists her rescue. Throw in a short-tempered bad guy, a cookie with an attitude and over a dozen other fairy tale misfits, and you've got the kind of mess that calls for a real hero. Luckily, there's one on hand... and his name is Shrek.

Based on the Oscar-winning DreamWorks Animation film, Shrek The Musical is a Tony Award-winning fairy tale adventure, featuring all-new songs from Jeanine Tesori (Thoroughly Modern Millie; Caroline, or Change) and a sidesplitting book by David Lindsay-Abaire. Shrek brings all the beloved characters you know from the film to life on stage and proves there's more to the story than meets the ears.

20260410-loves-labors-lost-the-musical-b.title: Love's Labor's Lost (the musical) by The Theatre Company (TTC)
20260410-loves-labors-lost-the-musical-b.venue_address: 3125 S. Texas Ave., Suite 500 (behind Joann Fabrics in the Tejas Center) Bryan, TX, 77802
20260410-loves-labors-lost-the-musical-b.rss_description_html:
Romance, revelry, and enchanting music ignite in this contemporary, yet lovingly faithful, musical adaptation of Shakespeare's comedy. Using the original text, Love's Labour's Lost reunites Obie Award winner, Michael Friedman (Bloody Bloody Andrew Jackson, The Fortress of Solitude) and two-time Tony Award nominee, Alex Timbers (Peter and the Starcatcher) as they bring their one-of-a-kind sensibility to the immortal words of the Bard.

The King and his best buds decide at their five-year college reunion to swear off the joys of women. But when four cute, clever girls from their past show up, they're forced to reconsider all of that nonsense! Add in an outlandish Spanish exchange student, a performance art-loving professor, and an entire brass band, and love and devotion are put to the test with hilarious results

20260220-annie-the-musical-by-the-theatr.title: Annie, the musical by The Theatre Company (TTC)
20260220-annie-the-musical-by-the-theatr.venue_address: 3125 S. Texas Ave., Suite 500 (behind Joann Fabrics in the Tejas Center) Bryan, TX, 77802
20260220-annie-the-musical-by-the-theatr.rss_description_html: Based on the popular comic strip by Harold Gray, Annie has become a worldwide phenomenon and was the winner of seven Tony Awards, including Best Musical. The beloved book and score by Tony Award winners, Thomas Meehan, Charles Strouse and Martin Charnin, features some of the greatest musical theatre hits ever written, including "Tomorrow."

20251219-the-duke-ellington-nutcracker-b.title: The Duke Ellington Nutcracker by ATX Artists for Social Impact
20251219-the-duke-ellington-nutcracker-b.rss_description_html:
Don’t miss a one-night-only theatrical production presented by ATX Artists for Social Impact and Sofar Sounds that blends artistic excellence, immersive storytelling, socially relevant themes, mentorship, and multidisciplinary collaboration together for a wonderful charitable cause in line with ATX Artists for Social Impact’s mission.

In this socially conscious reimagining of the classic fairytale, Capital Contemporary Ballet and the ATX Jazz Orchestra make their official debut, joining forces to tell a new story about community, compassion, and creative expression. Musical Direction by Joshua Alderete. Original Choreography by Caitlin Elledge.

Additionally, talented music students from the Huston-Tillotson University Jazz Program have been selected to perform in the orchestra to kick off our HBCU Artist Development initiative.

20260220-the-musical-comedy-murders-of-1.title: The Musical Comedy Murders of 1940 by Broke Thespians Theatre Company
20260220-the-musical-comedy-murders-of-1.rss_description_html:
Directed by Summer Jones

A creative team responsible for a flop musical plagued by the "Stage Door Slasher" gathers at a mansion during a blizzard for a new audition, believing one of them is the killer. The evening quickly turns into a farcical whodunit, complete with secret passages, disappearing bodies, German spies, and non-stop mayhem, as the frantic group tries to unmask the murderer before they become the next victims.
